options.description:
Used to include specific contact properties in the results. By default, the results will only include Contact ID and will not include the values for any properties for your Contact.

Including this parameter will include the data for the specified property in the results. You can include this parameter multiple times to request multiple properties separated by a comma: ,.

. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.
options.name: propertiesCollection

options.description: Whether to include specific Contact properties in the returned results. Choose from a list, or specify IDs using an expression. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.
options.name: associatedContactIds

options.description: Main reason customer reached out for help. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: category

options.description: The date the ticket was closed. When using expressions, the time should be specified in YYYY-MM-DD hh-mm-ss format.
options.name: closeDate

options.description: The date the ticket was created. When using expressions, the time should be specified in YYYY-MM-DD hh-mm-ss format.
options.name: createDate

options.description: Description of the ticket
options.name: description

options.description: The ID of the pipeline the ticket is in. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: pipelineId

options.description: The level of attention needed on the ticket. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: priority

options.description: The action taken to resolve the ticket. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: resolution

options.description: Channel where ticket was originally submitted. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: source

options.description: The stage ID of the pipeline the ticket is in; depends on Pipeline ID. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: stageId

options.description: The user from your team that the ticket is assigned to. You can assign additional users to a ticket record by creating a custom HubSpot user property. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.
options.name: ticketOwnerId

properties.errorMessage: Not a valid HubSpot Ticket ID

options.description: Whether to include specific Ticket properties in the returned results. Choose from a list, or specify IDs using an expression. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.
options.name: properties

options.description: Works similarly to properties=, but this parameter will include the history for the specified property, instead of just including the current value. Use this parameter when you need the full history of changes to a property's value.
options.name: propertiesWithHistory

properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit
properties.name: returnAll

properties.description: Max number of results to return
properties.name: limit

options.name: properties

options.description: Works similarly to properties=, but this parameter will include the history for the specified property, instead of just including the current value. Use this parameter when you need the full history of changes to a property's value.
options.name: propertiesWithHistory
